info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 11:40PM EDT until May 27 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT FRIDAY FOR JACKSON COUNTY... At 1140 PM EDT, Heavy rainfall had ended earlier across Jackson County, but a new round of moderate rain is entering the county and may persist for the next 1-2 hours before another lull occurs. Storm-total rainfall of 3 to 6 inches was observed across the county, with the heaviest rain across the southern third of the county over the headwaters of the Tuckasegee River. Unusually high flows continue to impact the reservoirs of the east and west forks of the Tuckasegee River and these high flows are continuing to cause significant rises along the Tuckasegee River. This is resulting in widespread Minor to isolated Moderate flooding within the valley and this flooding is expected to continue for several more hours before the floodwave moves downstream into Swain County and conditions gradually improve by Friday morning. Several vulnerable mobile homes along Fred Smith Road near the community of Tuckasegee reported floodwaters 3-4 feet deep earlier and evacuations have been needed this evening. Additional impacts are likely to develop downstream including additional significant flooding. Residents and other persons near the Tuckasegee River need to be prepared to heed any evacuation orders or other guidance from Jackson County Emergency Management and seek higher ground if the river continues to rise. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses continues tonight. Areas along the east and west forks of the Tuckasegee River and areas of the Tuckasegee River downstream from the confluence near NC 107 and NC 281 to Cullowhee to Webster to Dillsboro to Whittier will continue to see rises and Minor to Moderate flooding. Moderate flooding is defined as significant flooding of flood-prone, low-lying areas adjacent to streams including farmland, campgrounds, greenways, parks, and boat-access areas. Additionally, some structural flooding is expected, including homes that are immediately adjacent to streams. Some locations that will continue to experience flash flooding include... Sylva, Cherokee, Cullowhee, Webster, Dillsboro, Cashiers, Lake Glenville, Tuckasegee, Savannah, and Whittier. Additional rainfall of 1-2 inches is possible tonight before the heavy rain threat finally ends later tonight. This will prolong ongoing flooding and may cause new areas of flooding to develop. Locally heavier rainfall is possible. It will be critically important to stay weather aware and be prepared to seek higher ground if new flash flooding develops. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Please heed all messages and evacuation orders from Jackson County Emergency Management officials. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Obey all barricades and find alternative routes to stay alive. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
